intro: Kadua remyi, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a shrub or small tree native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woody structure and evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. Kadua remyi is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its hardiness and historical significance, it is considered an important species in Hawaiian ecosystems.
